summary: This is a brief email notification from April 26, 2019, canceling a weekly meeting for a CID UC (likely Criminal Investigations Division Undercover) unit that had been scheduled for Wednesdays at 2:00 p.m. since December 5, 2018. The email's significance is minimal, showing only routine administrative scheduling within a law enforcement context related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: CID UC Weekly Meeting Established
events.description: A weekly meeting for a CID UC (Criminal Investigations Division Undercover) unit was scheduled to occur every Wednesday at 2:00 p.m.

events.title: CID UC Weekly Meeting Canceled
events.description: The previously established weekly CID UC meeting was canceled via an email marked as high importance.

keyFacts: The document is an administrative email canceling a weekly law enforcement meeting.
The meeting was for a 'CID UC' unit, likely referring to a Criminal Investigations Division Undercover team.
The meeting had been scheduled every Wednesday at 2:00 p.m. since December 5, 2018.
The cancellation email was sent on April 26, 2019, and was marked as high importance.
No specific individuals, victims, or case details related to Epstein are mentioned in this text.
